November 14, 1957
Miss Louise C. Erana
5006 Wlckett Terrace
Bethesda, Maryland
Dear Miss Erana:
In answer to your letter of November 3 I am enclosing a complete set of
Fact Sheet Series I which deals primarily with television as a teaching
tool, and also a Fact Sheet Index.
When you look through the Index, you will note that there are other Fact
Sheets in different series which touch on television in classrooms and so
forth. If you desire a copy of any of these, please let me know by giving
me the Series number and copy number. The price is ten cents per copy.
For the enclosed set, we did not charge you the usual rate, but will instead
expect your remittance of $2.50 (a savings of eighty cents). This discount
is due to the fact that we hope to incorporate the Fact Sheets into the NAEB
Journal in the near future and will therefore not wish to keep too plentiful
a supply of the mimeographed Fact Sheets cm hand. If you wish to send
your remittance by check, please make it out to the NATIONAL ASSOCIATION
OF EDUCATIONAL BROADCASTERS.
I have forwarded your letter on to another department where I am sure your
request for a copy of the January AERT Journal will be taken care of immediÂ¬
ately. If I can be of further service to you, please let me know.
Sincerely,
(Mrs.) Judith B. Gans
Secretary
